newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Tung Fong Hung in rationalisation plans.
newsitem.headline: Tung Fong Hung in rationalisation plans.

text.p: Chinese medicine retailer Tung Fong Hung (Holdings) Ltd said it was looking into amalgamating its medicine business with that of its 29.09 percent owned Nam Pei Hong (Holdings) Ltd.
Tung Fong Hung such a move would be aimed at promoting sales effectively and improving operational efficiency, leading to significant cost savings.
"At present, no decision has been made nor any binding agreement has been entered into by the company regarding such proposed rationalisation plans," Tung Fong Hung said.
Tung Fong Hung also said it could not ascertain the extent of the impact on its financial position arising from an interim loss of HK$85.1 million reported by Nam Pei Hong.
"The investigations are still in progress and the directors of the company would assess the impact pending the outcome of the investigations," it said.
Tung Fong Hung said it would made a further statement if the impact is ascertained.
